issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Vectorization : Support loading bucketed tables using sorted dynamic partition optimizer

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
Followup to HIVE-20510 with remaining issues,

 

1. Avoid using Reflection.
2. In VectorizationContext, use correct place to setup the VectorExpression. It may be missed in certain cases.
3. In BucketNumExpression, make sure that a value is not overwritten before it is processed. Use a flag to achieve this.

cc [~gopalv]
fields.summary: Vectorization : Support loading bucketed tables using sorted dynamic partition optimizer - II

ATTACHMENT ID: 12941298 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build
Checking for row number set alone is sufficient right? Do we also need to check for bucketNumSet? If not later flag can probably be removed.

They both are set separately. Hence individual flags.

 

setRowNum(), setBucketNum() setBucketNum() may result in wrong results.
ok. I was under the impression that for this rowNum set this bucketNum. Not exactly sure how/where setRowNum and setBucketNum methods are invoked.
Thanks for the review. You may look it in VectorReduceSinkObjectHashOperator.java
